fields.value: Catalog of massive molecular clouds in the Milky Way

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This is the catalog of 1064 molecular clouds identified in Rice et al. (2016, submitted to ApJ): "A Uniform Catalog of Molecular Clouds in the Milky Way".

The all-Galaxy CO survey of Dame, Hartmann, & Thaddeus (2001) is by far the most uniform, large-scale CO survey ever performed in the Galaxy. We have performed a new dendrogram-based decomposition of this CO survey, in which molecular clouds are defined as self-contained, connected regions of emission with an upper bound on complexity. From this, we present a systematically produced catalog of 1064 massive molecular clouds throughout the entire Galactic plane.

publicationCitation.value:
Rice et al. (2016, submitted to ApJ):
"A Uniform Catalog of Molecular Clouds in the Milky Way"
